00041 /************************** PRIVATE DEFINITIONS *************************/
00042 //#define MCB_LPC_1768
00043 #define IAR_LPC_1768
00044 
00045 #ifdef MCB_LPC_1768
00046 /* LED pin in byte style on P1 */
00047 #define _EXT_IRQ        EINT0_IRQn
00048 #define _EXTINT         EXTI_EINT0
00049 #elif defined (IAR_LPC_1768)
00050 #define _EXT_IRQ        EINT2_IRQn
00051 #define _EXTINT         EXTI_EINT2
00052 #endif

00056         "********************************************************************************\n\r"
00057         "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r"

00060         "\t - Core: ARM CORTEX-M3 \n\r"
00061         "\t - Communicate via: UART0 - 115200 bps \n\r"
00062         "This example used to enter system in sleep mode and wake up it by using external \n\r"
00063         "interrupt\n\r"

00077 /*----------------- INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINES --------------------------*/
00078 #ifdef MCB_LPC_1768
00079 /*********************************************************************/
00084 void EINT0_IRQHandler(void)
00085 {
00086           //clear the EINT0 flag
00087           EXTI_ClearEXTIFlag(0);
00088 
00089 }
00090 #elif defined (IAR_LPC_1768)
00091 /*********************************************************************/
00096 void EINT2_IRQHandler(void)
00097 {
00098           //clear the EINT2 flag
00099           EXTI_ClearEXTIFlag(2);
00100 }
00101 
00102 #endif

00119 void delay (void) {
00120   unsigned int i;
00121 
00122   for (i = 0; i < 0x100000; i++) {
00123   }
00124 }
00125 
00126 /*********************************************************************/
00131 void InitLED(void)
00132 {
00133 #ifdef MCB_LPC_1768
00134 /* Use LEDs P1.28 and P1.29*/
00135         GPIO_SetDir(1, (1<<28)|(1<<29), 1); //set P1.28 and P1.29 is output
00136         GPIO_ClearValue(1, (1<<28)|(1<<29));//Turn off LEDs
00137 #elif defined (IAR_LPC_1768)
00138 /* Use LED1 (P1.25) and LED2 (P0.4)*/
00139         GPIO_SetDir(1, (1<<25), 1); //set P1.25 is output
00140         GPIO_SetDir(0, (1<<4), 1);  //set P0.4 is output
00141         GPIO_SetValue(1, (1<<25));  //Turn off LED1
00142         GPIO_SetValue(0, (1<<4));       //Turn off LED2
00143 #endif
00144 }
00145 
00146 
00147 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00148 /*********************************************************************/
00153 int c_entry (void)
00154 {
00155         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00156         EXTI_InitTypeDef EXTICfg;
00157 
00158         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00159          * – 115200bps
00160          * – 8 data bit
00161          * – No parity
00162          * – 1 stop bit
00163          * – No flow control
00164          */
00165         debug_frmwrk_init();
00166 
00167         // print welcome screen
00168         print_menu();
00169 
00170         /* Initialize LEDs
00171          * - If using MCB1700 board:
00172          *              LEDs: P1.28 and P1.29 are available
00173          * - If using IAR1700 board:
00174          *              LEDs: LED1(P1.25) and LED2(P0.4) are available
00175          * Turn off LEDs after initialize
00176          */
00177         InitLED();
00178 
00179         /* Initialize EXT pin and registers
00180          * - If using MCB1700 board: EXTI0 is configured
00181          * - If using IAR1700 board: EXTI2 is configured
00182          */
00183 #ifdef MCB_LPC_1768
00184         /* P2.10 as /EINT0 */
00185         PinCfg.Funcnum = 1;
00186         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00187         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00188         PinCfg.Pinnum = 10;
00189         PinCfg.Portnum = 2;
00190         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00191 #elif defined (IAR_LPC_1768)
00192         /* P2.12 as /EINT2 */
00193         PinCfg.Funcnum = 1;
00194         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00195         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00196         PinCfg.Pinnum = 12;
00197         PinCfg.Portnum = 2;
00198         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00199 #endif
00200 
00201         EXTI_Init();
00202 
00203         EXTICfg.EXTI_Line = _EXTINT;
00204         /* edge sensitive */
00205         EXTICfg.EXTI_Mode = EXTI_MODE_EDGE_SENSITIVE;
00206         EXTICfg.EXTI_polarity = EXTI_POLARITY_LOW_ACTIVE_OR_FALLING_EDGE;
00207         EXTI_ClearEXTIFlag(_EXTINT);
00208         EXTI_Config(&EXTICfg);
00209 
00210         NVIC_SetPriorityGrouping(4);
00211         NVIC_SetPriority(_EXT_IRQ, 0);
00212         NVIC_EnableIRQ(_EXT_IRQ);
00213 
00214         _DBG_("First LED is blinking in normal mode...\n\r"     \
00215                   "Press '1' to enter system in sleep mode.\n\r"\
00216                   "If you want to wake-up the system, press INT/WAKE-UP button.");
00217         while(_DG !='1')
00218         {
00219                 //Blink first LED
00220 #ifdef MCB_LPC_1768
00221                 //blink LED P1.28
00222                 GPIO_SetValue(1, (1<<28));
00223                 delay();
00224                 GPIO_ClearValue(1, (1<<28));
00225                 delay();
00226 #elif defined (IAR_LPC_1768)
00227                 //blink LED1 (P1.25)
00228                 GPIO_SetValue(1, (1<<25));
00229                 delay();
00230                 GPIO_ClearValue(1, (1<<25));
00231                 delay();
00232 #endif
00233         }
00234 
00235         _DBG_("Sleeping...");
00236         // Enter target power down mode
00237         CLKPWR_Sleep();
00238 
00239         // MCU will be here after waking up
00240         _DBG_("System wake-up! Second LED is blinking...");
00241         //turn off first LED
00242 #ifdef MCB_LPC_1768
00243         GPIO_ClearValue(1, (1<<29));
00244 #elif defined (IAR_LPC_1768)
00245         GPIO_SetValue(1, (1<<25));
00246 #endif
00247         while (1)
00248         {
00249                 //Blink second LED
00250 #ifdef MCB_LPC_1768
00251                 //blink LED P1.29
00252                 GPIO_SetValue(1, (1<<29));
00253                 delay();
00254                 GPIO_ClearValue(1, (1<<29));
00255                 delay();
00256 #elif defined (IAR_LPC_1768)
00257                 //blink LED2 (P0.4)
00258                 GPIO_SetValue(0, (1<<4));
00259                 delay();
00260                 GPIO_ClearValue(0, (1<<4));
00261                 delay();
00262 #endif
00263         }
00264 }
00265 
00266 
00267 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00268    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00269    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00270    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00271    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00272 int main(void)
00273 {
00274     return c_entry();
00275 }

00284 *******************************************************************************/

00288          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
